question.title: Remove Zero Sum Consecutive Nodes from Linked List
question.content:
Given the head of a linked list, we repeatedly delete consecutive sequences of nodes that sum to 0 until there are no such sequences.

After doing so, return the head of the final linked list.  You may return any such answer.

 

(Note that in the examples below, all sequences are serializations of ListNode objects.)

Example 1:

Input: head = [1,2,-3,3,1]
Output: [3,1]
Note: The answer [1,2,1] would also be accepted.

Example 2:

Input: head = [1,2,3,-3,4]
Output: [1,2,4]

Example 3:

Input: head = [1,2,3,-3,-2]
Output: [1]

 

Constraints:

  • The given linked list will contain between 1 and 1000 nodes.
  • Each node in the linked list has -1000 <= node.val <= 1000.
question.similarQuestions: [{"title": "Delete N Nodes After M Nodes of a Linked List", "titleSlug": "delete-n-nodes-after-m-nodes-of-a-linked-list", "difficulty": "Easy", "translatedTitle": null}]
hints: Convert the linked list into an array.
While you can find a non-empty subarray with sum = 0, erase it.
Convert the array into a linked list.

rephrased.body: Given the head of a linked list, remove all consecutive sequences of nodes that sum to 0. Repeat this process until no such sequences remain. Return the head of the final linked list.
constraints: The linked list will contain between 1 and 1000 nodes.
Each node value will be between -1000 and 1000 (inclusive).

testcases.explanation: The sequence [1, 2, -3] sums to 0, and [3] sums to 3 , and finally [3,1] are left.
